meanings.definition: The process of becoming accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: Her acclimatizations to the cold weather took some time, but she eventually got used to it.
meanings.sent2: The acclimatizations of the tropical plants to the desert climate were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's acclimatizations to the hot desert made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His acclimatizations to the fast-paced city life were like a fish learning to walk.
meanings.sent5: The acclimatizations of the astronaut to zero gravity were truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The acclimatizations of the new student to the school routine were smooth.
meanings.sent2: After many acclimatizations, she finally felt at home in the bustling city.
meanings.sent3: The acclimatizations of the cat to the noisy dog next door were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His acclimatizations to the corporate world felt like navigating a maze blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: The acclimatizations of the team to the challenging project were challenging but rewarding.
